abstract.p: Letter from Sonia Jaffe Robbins questions whether electronic publishing is really in best interests of readers (May 23 article)

block.p: Re ''4 Giants Set to Embrace Electronic Publishing'' (Business Day, May 23):

Simon & Schuster's and Random House's deals with Microsoft to publish titles readable only using Microsoft's reader software is analogous to their publishing hard copy books readable only under General Electric incandescent bulbs, so that reading them in sunlight or with some other manufacturer's light bulbs would be impossible.
Re ''4 Giants Set to Embrace Electronic Publishing'' (Business Day, May 23):

Simon & Schuster's and Random House's deals with Microsoft to publish titles readable only using Microsoft's reader software is analogous to their publishing hard copy books readable only under General Electric incandescent bulbs, so that reading them in sunlight or with some other manufacturer's light bulbs would be impossible.
Is this really in the best interests of readers, who might happen not to be heavily invested in Microsoft?
SONIA JAFFE ROBBINS New York, May 23, 2000
